content.description: Stomping Slabs is a fun slab climb. Using crimps, edges, and a horizontal crack, it ascends the face in between two small pine trees in the horizontal crack.
content.protection: There is a tree at the top, and you can use a bar that is sticking up - it isÂ rusty, so you should probably back it up. You could also boulder it. In that case, bring many pads.
content.location: This is to the left of the small pine tree in the crack, and it is to the right of a diagonal overlap and another pine tree in the crack.

content.description: Coreshot is a fun, easy, slab climb that ascends the face to the right of the little tree growing in the crack.
content.protection: There is a bomber tree around 20-30 feet back, and there is also a rusty bar that wouldn't recommend using alone.
content.location: Start anywhere on the slabby face, and make sure you are to the right of a small pine tree that is growing out of a crack midway up.

content.description: Slab Hammer is an easy, straightforward climb. The route goes directly below the two bolts on the left.
content.protection: There are two bolts at the top for a TR or bring a pad or two for bouldering.
content.location: Start below the two bolts, and go directly up from there.

content.description: The rock is a 15-20 foot slab with some bolts and trees farther back. At the bottom of the cliff, there is a big clearing.
